Meanwhile, Tasmanian Labor senator Helen Polley says the party will suffer dire electoral consequences if it embraces gay marriage. “I believe we could lose seats here in Tasmania. I believe we would certainly not make any ground up in Queensland,” she said.

On the issue of equality Helen Polley is on whatever side will lose the least votes.

I’m sure looking back in 30 years, long after gay marriage is made federal law and becomes commonplace, as always eventually happens with issues of equality, Helen Polley will be comfortable with the grave concern she showed for votes.
